explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) applicability in the Baltic Sea shipping corridor; spatial anchor: Travemünde (D) – Liepāja (LV) route
Operational Protocol Rationale: Passenger vessels of this size and configuration typically follow straight, predictable paths within designated shipping lanes to maintain safe separation from opposing traffic and avoid navigational hazards. The observed stable speed, consistent course over ground, and tight alignment between heading and motion direction reflect autopilot-assisted transit along a predefined route, which is standard practice in regulated maritime corridors. This behavior contrasts with maneuvering patterns seen near ports or in congested waters, where frequent course and speed adjustments would be expected. Given the vessel’s location near a major Baltic shipping lane and its operational profile—no hazardous cargo, moderate draught, and engine-powered transit—the most logical interpretation is steady-state cruising along a fixed route, consistent with international collision avoidance guidelines and regional traffic management protocols.
'''
